21enum class UVFsType: std::underlying_type_t<uv_fs_type> {
22 UNKNOWN = UV_FS_UNKNOWN,
23 CUSTOM = UV_FS_CUSTOM,
24 OPEN = UV_FS_OPEN,
25 CLOSE = UV_FS_CLOSE,
26 READ = UV_FS_READ,
27 WRITE = UV_FS_WRITE,
28 SENDFILE = UV_FS_SENDFILE,
29 STAT = UV_FS_STAT,
30 LSTAT = UV_FS_LSTAT,
31 FSTAT = UV_FS_FSTAT,
32 FTRUNCATE = UV_FS_FTRUNCATE,
33 UTIME = UV_FS_UTIME,
34 FUTIME = UV_FS_FUTIME,
35 ACCESS = UV_FS_ACCESS,
36 CHMOD = UV_FS_CHMOD,
37 FCHMOD = UV_FS_FCHMOD,
38 FSYNC = UV_FS_FSYNC,
39 FDATASYNC = UV_FS_FDATASYNC,
40 UNLINK = UV_FS_UNLINK,
41 RMDIR = UV_FS_RMDIR,
42 MKDIR = UV_FS_MKDIR,
43 MKDTEMP = UV_FS_MKDTEMP,
44 RENAME = UV_FS_RENAME,
45 SCANDIR = UV_FS_SCANDIR,
46 LINK = UV_FS_LINK,
47 SYMLINK = UV_FS_SYMLINK,
48 READLINK = UV_FS_READLINK,
49 CHOWN = UV_FS_CHOWN,
50 FCHOWN = UV_FS_FCHOWN,
51 REALPATH = UV_FS_REALPATH,
52 COPYFILE = UV_FS_COPYFILE,
53 LCHOWN = UV_FS_LCHOWN,
54 OPENDIR = UV_FS_OPENDIR,
55 READDIR = UV_FS_READDIR,
56 CLOSEDIR = UV_FS_CLOSEDIR,
57 STATFS = UV_FS_STATFS,
58 MKSTEMP = UV_FS_MKSTEMP,
59 LUTIME = UV_FS_LUTIME
60};
61
62
63enum class UVDirentTypeT: std::underlying_type_t<uv_dirent_type_t> {
64 UNKNOWN = UV_DIRENT_UNKNOWN,
65 FILE = UV_DIRENT_FILE,
66 DIR = UV_DIRENT_DIR,
67 LINK = UV_DIRENT_LINK,
68 FIFO = UV_DIRENT_FIFO,
69 SOCKET = UV_DIRENT_SOCKET,
70 CHAR = UV_DIRENT_CHAR,
71 BLOCK = UV_DIRENT_BLOCK
72};
73
74
75enum class UVFileOpenFlags: int {
76 APPEND = UV_FS_O_APPEND,
77 CREAT = UV_FS_O_CREAT,
78 DIRECT = UV_FS_O_DIRECT,
79 DIRECTORY = UV_FS_O_DIRECTORY,
80 DSYNC = UV_FS_O_DSYNC,
81 EXCL = UV_FS_O_EXCL,
82 EXLOCK = UV_FS_O_EXLOCK,
83 FILEMAP = UV_FS_O_FILEMAP,
84 NOATIME = UV_FS_O_NOATIME,
85 NOCTTY = UV_FS_O_NOCTTY,
86 NOFOLLOW = UV_FS_O_NOFOLLOW,
87 NONBLOCK = UV_FS_O_NONBLOCK,
88 RANDOM = UV_FS_O_RANDOM,
89 RDONLY = UV_FS_O_RDONLY,
90 RDWR = UV_FS_O_RDWR,
91 SEQUENTIAL = UV_FS_O_SEQUENTIAL,
92 SHORT_LIVED = UV_FS_O_SHORT_LIVED,
93 SYMLINK = UV_FS_O_SYMLINK,
94 SYNC = UV_FS_O_SYNC,
95 TEMPORARY = UV_FS_O_TEMPORARY,
96 TRUNC = UV_FS_O_TRUNC,
97 WRONLY = UV_FS_O_WRONLY
98};
99
100
101enum class UVCopyFileFlags: int {
102 EXCL = UV_FS_COPYFILE_EXCL,
103 FICLONE = UV_FS_COPYFILE_FICLONE,
104 FICLONE_FORCE = UV_FS_COPYFILE_FICLONE_FORCE
105};
106
107
108enum class UVSymLinkFlags: int {
109 DIR = UV_FS_SYMLINK_DIR,
110 JUNCTION = UV_FS_SYMLINK_JUNCTION
111};

117/**
118 * @brief Default FsEvent event.
119 *
120 * Available types are:
121 *
122 * * `FsRequest::Type::UNKNOWN`
123 * * `FsRequest::Type::CUSTOM`
124 * * `FsRequest::Type::OPEN`
125 * * `FsRequest::Type::CLOSE`
126 * * `FsRequest::Type::READ`
127 * * `FsRequest::Type::WRITE`
128 * * `FsRequest::Type::SENDFILE`
129 * * `FsRequest::Type::STAT`
130 * * `FsRequest::Type::LSTAT`
131 * * `FsRequest::Type::FSTAT`
132 * * `FsRequest::Type::FTRUNCATE`
133 * * `FsRequest::Type::UTIME`
134 * * `FsRequest::Type::FUTIME`
135 * * `FsRequest::Type::ACCESS`
136 * * `FsRequest::Type::CHMOD`
137 * * `FsRequest::Type::FCHMOD`
138 * * `FsRequest::Type::FSYNC`
139 * * `FsRequest::Type::FDATASYNC`
140 * * `FsRequest::Type::UNLINK`
141 * * `FsRequest::Type::RMDIR`
142 * * `FsRequest::Type::MKDIR`
143 * * `FsRequest::Type::MKDTEMP`
144 * * `FsRequest::Type::RENAME`
145 * * `FsRequest::Type::SCANDIR`
146 * * `FsRequest::Type::LINK`
147 * * `FsRequest::Type::SYMLINK`
148 * * `FsRequest::Type::READLINK`
149 * * `FsRequest::Type::CHOWN`
150 * * `FsRequest::Type::FCHOWN`
151 * * `FsRequest::Type::REALPATH`
152 * * `FsRequest::Type::COPYFILE`
153 * * `FsRequest::Type::LCHOWN`
154 * * `FsRequest::Type::OPENDIR`
155 * * `FsRequest::Type::READDIR`
156 * * `FsRequest::Type::CLOSEDIR`
157 * * `FsRequest::Type::STATFS`
158 * * `FsRequest::Type::MKSTEMP`
159 * * `FsRequest::Type::LUTIME`
160 *
161 * It will be emitted by FsReq and/or FileReq according with their
162 * functionalities.
163 *
164 * See the official
165 * [documentation](http://docs.libuv.org/en/v1.x/fs.html#c.uv_fs_type)
166 * for further details.
167 */
168template<details::UVFsType e>
169struct FsEvent {
170 FsEvent(const char *pathname) noexcept: path{pathname} {}
171
172 const char * path; /*!< The path affecting the request. */
173};
174
175
176/**
177 * @brief FsEvent event specialization for `FsRequest::Type::READ`.
178 *
179 * It will be emitted by FsReq and/or FileReq according with their
180 * functionalities.
181 */
182template<>
183struct FsEvent<details::UVFsType::READ> {
184 FsEvent(const char *pathname, std::unique_ptr<const char[]> buf, std::size_t sz) noexcept
185 : path{pathname}, data{std::move(buf)}, size{sz}
186 {}
187
188 const char * path; /*!< The path affecting the request. */
189 std::unique_ptr<const char[]> data; /*!< A bunch of data read from the given path. */
190 std::size_t size; /*!< The amount of data read from the given path. */
191};
192
193
194/**
195 * @brief FsEvent event specialization for `FsRequest::Type::WRITE`.
196 *
197 * It will be emitted by FsReq and/or FileReq according with their
198 * functionalities.
199 */
200template<>
201struct FsEvent<details::UVFsType::WRITE> {
202 FsEvent(const char *pathname, std::size_t sz) noexcept
203 : path{pathname}, size{sz}
204 {}
205
206 const char * path; /*!< The path affecting the request. */
207 std::size_t size; /*!< The amount of data written to the given path. */
208};
209
210
211/**
212 * @brief FsEvent event specialization for `FsRequest::Type::SENDFILE`.
213 *
214 * It will be emitted by FsReq and/or FileReq according with their
215 * functionalities.
216 */
217template<>
218struct FsEvent<details::UVFsType::SENDFILE> {
219 FsEvent(const char *pathname, std::size_t sz) noexcept
220 : path{pathname}, size{sz}
221 {}
222
223 const char * path; /*!< The path affecting the request. */
224 std::size_t size; /*!< The amount of data transferred. */
225};
226
227
228/**
229 * @brief FsEvent event specialization for `FsRequest::Type::STAT`.
230 *
231 * It will be emitted by FsReq and/or FileReq according with their
232 * functionalities.
233 */
234template<>
235struct FsEvent<details::UVFsType::STAT> {
236 FsEvent(const char *pathname, Stat curr) noexcept
237 : path{pathname}, stat{std::move(curr)}
238 {}
239
240 const char * path; /*!< The path affecting the request. */
241 Stat stat; /*!< An initialized instance of Stat. */
242};
243
244
245/**
246 * @brief FsEvent event specialization for `FsRequest::Type::FSTAT`.
247 *
248 * It will be emitted by FsReq and/or FileReq according with their
249 * functionalities.
250 */
251template<>
252struct FsEvent<details::UVFsType::FSTAT> {
253 FsEvent(const char *pathname, Stat curr) noexcept
254 : path{pathname}, stat{std::move(curr)}
255 {}
256
257 const char * path; /*!< The path affecting the request. */
258 Stat stat; /*!< An initialized instance of Stat. */
259};
260
261
262/**
263 * @brief FsEvent event specialization for `FsRequest::Type::LSTAT`.
264 *
265 * It will be emitted by FsReq and/or FileReq according with their
266 * functionalities.
267 */
268template<>
269struct FsEvent<details::UVFsType::LSTAT> {
270 FsEvent(const char *pathname, Stat curr) noexcept
271 : path{pathname}, stat{std::move(curr)}
272 {}
273
274 const char * path; /*!< The path affecting the request. */
275 Stat stat; /*!< An initialized instance of Stat. */
276};
277
278
279/**
280 * @brief FsEvent event specialization for `FsRequest::Type::STATFS`.
281 *
282 * It will be emitted by FsReq and/or FileReq according with their
283 * functionalities.
284 */
285template<>
286struct FsEvent<details::UVFsType::STATFS> {
287 FsEvent(const char *pathname, Statfs curr) noexcept
288 : path{pathname}, statfs{std::move(curr)}
289 {}
290
291 const char * path; /*!< The path affecting the request. */
292 Statfs statfs; /*!< An initialized instance of Statfs. */
293};
294
295
296/**
297 * @brief FsEvent event specialization for `FsRequest::Type::MKSTEMP`.
298 *
299 * It will be emitted by FsReq and/or FileReq according with their
300 * functionalities.
301 */
302template<>
303struct FsEvent<details::UVFsType::MKSTEMP> {
304 FsEvent(const char *pathname, std::size_t desc) noexcept
305 : path{pathname}, descriptor{desc}
306 {}
307
308 const char * path; /*!< The created file path. */
309 std::size_t descriptor; /*!< The file descriptor as an integer. */
310};
311
312
313/**
314 * @brief FsEvent event specialization for `FsRequest::Type::SCANDIR`.
315 *
316 * It will be emitted by FsReq and/or FileReq according with their
317 * functionalities.
318 */
319template<>
320struct FsEvent<details::UVFsType::SCANDIR> {
321 FsEvent(const char *pathname, std::size_t sz) noexcept
322 : path{pathname}, size{sz}
323 {}
324
325 const char * path; /*!< The path affecting the request. */
326 std::size_t size; /*!< The number of directory entries selected. */
327};
328
329
330/**
331 * @brief FsEvent event specialization for `FsRequest::Type::READLINK`.
332 *
333 * It will be emitted by FsReq and/or FileReq according with their
334 * functionalities.
335 */
336template<>
337struct FsEvent<details::UVFsType::READLINK> {
338 explicit FsEvent(const char *pathname, const char *buf, std::size_t sz) noexcept
339 : path{pathname}, data{buf}, size{sz}
340 {}
341
342 const char * path; /*!< The path affecting the request. */
343 const char * data; /*!< A bunch of data read from the given path. */
344 std::size_t size; /*!< The amount of data read from the given path. */
345};
346
347
348/**
349 * @brief FsEvent event specialization for `FsRequest::Type::READDIR`.
350 *
351 * It will be emitted by FsReq and/or FileReq according with their
352 * functionalities.
353 */
354template<>
355struct FsEvent<details::UVFsType::READDIR> {
356 using EntryType = details::UVDirentTypeT;
357
358 FsEvent(const char *name, EntryType type, bool eos) noexcept
359 : name{name}, type{type}, eos{eos}
360 {}
361
362 const char * name; /*!< The name of the last entry. */
363 EntryType type; /*!< The entry type. */
364 bool eos; /*!< True if there a no more entries to read. */
365};
366
367
368/**
369 * @brief Base class for FsReq and/or FileReq.
370 *
371 * Not directly instantiable, should not be used by the users of the library.
372 */
373template<typename T>
374class FsRequest: public Request<T, uv_fs_t> {
375protected:
376 template<details::UVFsType e>
377 static void fsGenericCallback(uv_fs_t *req) {
378 auto ptr = Request<T, uv_fs_t>::reserve(req);
379 if(req->result < 0) { ptr->publish(ErrorEvent{req->result}); }
380 else { ptr->publish(FsEvent<e>{req->path}); }
381 }
382
383 template<details::UVFsType e>
384 static void fsResultCallback(uv_fs_t *req) {
385 auto ptr = Request<T, uv_fs_t>::reserve(req);
386 if(req->result < 0) { ptr->publish(ErrorEvent{req->result}); }
387 else { ptr->publish(FsEvent<e>{req->path, static_cast<std::size_t>(req->result)}); }
388 }
389
390 template<details::UVFsType e>
391 static void fsStatCallback(uv_fs_t *req) {
392 auto ptr = Request<T, uv_fs_t>::reserve(req);
393 if(req->result < 0) { ptr->publish(ErrorEvent{req->result}); }
394 else { ptr->publish(FsEvent<e>{req->path, req->statbuf}); }
395 }
396
397 static void fsStatfsCallback(uv_fs_t *req) {
398 auto ptr = Request<T, uv_fs_t>::reserve(req);
399 if(req->result < 0) { ptr->publish(ErrorEvent{req->result}); }
400 else { ptr->publish(FsEvent<Type::STATFS>{req->path, *static_cast<Statfs *>(req->ptr)}); }
401 }
402
403 template<typename... Args>
404 void cleanupAndInvoke(Args&&... args) {
405 uv_fs_req_cleanup(this->get());
406 this->invoke(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
407 }
408
409 template<typename F, typename... Args>
410 void cleanupAndInvokeSync(F &&f, Args&&... args) {
411 uv_fs_req_cleanup(this->get());
412 std::forward<F>(f)(std::forward<Args>(args)..., nullptr);
413 }
414
415public:
416 using Time = std::chrono::duration<double>;
417 using Type = details::UVFsType;
418 using EntryType = details::UVDirentTypeT;
419
420 using Request<T, uv_fs_t>::Request;
421};
422
423
424/**
425 * @brief The FileReq request.
426 *
427 * Cross-platform sync and async filesystem operations.<br/>
428 * All file operations are run on the threadpool.
429 *
430 * To create a `FileReq` through a `Loop`, no arguments are required.
431 *
432 * See the official
433 * [documentation](http://docs.libuv.org/en/v1.x/fs.html)
434 * for further details.
435 */
436class FileReq final: public FsRequest<FileReq> {
437 static constexpr uv_file BAD_FD = -1;
438
439 static void fsOpenCallback(uv_fs_t *req);
440 static void fsCloseCallback(uv_fs_t *req);
441 static void fsReadCallback(uv_fs_t *req);
442
443public:
444 using FileOpen = details::UVFileOpenFlags;
445
446 using FsRequest::FsRequest;
447
448 ~FileReq() noexcept;
449
450 /**
451 * @brief Async [close](http://linux.die.net/man/2/close).
452 *
453 * Emit a `FsEvent<FileReq::Type::CLOSE>` event when completed.<br/>
454 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
455 */
456 void close();
457
458 /**
459 * @brief Sync [close](http://linux.die.net/man/2/close).
460 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
461 */
462 bool closeSync();
463
464 /**
465 * @brief Async [open](http://linux.die.net/man/2/open).
466 *
467 * Emit a `FsEvent<FileReq::Type::OPEN>` event when completed.<br/>
468 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
469 *
470 * Available flags are:
471 *
472 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::APPEND`
473 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::CREAT`
474 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::DIRECT`
475 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::DIRECTORY`
476 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::DSYNC`
477 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::EXCL`
478 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::EXLOCK`
479 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::FILEMAP`
480 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::NOATIME`
481 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::NOCTTY`
482 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::NOFOLLOW`
483 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::NONBLOCK`
484 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::RANDOM`
485 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::RDONLY`
486 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::RDWR`
487 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::SEQUENTIAL`
488 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::SHORT_LIVED`
489 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::SYMLINK`
490 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::SYNC`
491 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::TEMPORARY`
492 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::TRUNC`
493 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::WRONLY`
494 *
495 * See the official
496 * [documentation](http://docs.libuv.org/en/v1.x/fs.html#file-open-constants)
497 * for further details.
498 *
499 * @param path A valid path name for a file.
500 * @param flags Flags made out of underlying constants.
501 * @param mode Mode, as described in the official documentation.
502 */
503 void open(std::string path, Flags<FileOpen> flags, int mode);
504
505 /**
506 * @brief Sync [open](http://linux.die.net/man/2/open).
507 *
508 * Available flags are:
509 *
510 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::APPEND`
511 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::CREAT`
512 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::DIRECT`
513 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::DIRECTORY`
514 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::DSYNC`
515 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::EXCL`
516 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::EXLOCK`
517 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::FILEMAP`
518 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::NOATIME`
519 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::NOCTTY`
520 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::NOFOLLOW`
521 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::NONBLOCK`
522 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::RANDOM`
523 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::RDONLY`
524 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::RDWR`
525 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::SEQUENTIAL`
526 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::SHORT_LIVED`
527 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::SYMLINK`
528 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::SYNC`
529 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::TEMPORARY`
530 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::TRUNC`
531 * * `FileReq::FileOpen::WRONLY`
532 *
533 * See the official
534 * [documentation](http://docs.libuv.org/en/v1.x/fs.html#file-open-constants)
535 * for further details.
536 *
537 * @param path A valid path name for a file.
538 * @param flags Flags made out of underlying constants.
539 * @param mode Mode, as described in the official documentation.
540 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
541 */
542 bool openSync(std::string path, Flags<FileOpen> flags, int mode);
543
544 /**
545 * @brief Async [read](http://linux.die.net/man/2/preadv).
546 *
547 * Emit a `FsEvent<FileReq::Type::READ>` event when completed.<br/>
548 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
549 *
550 * @param offset Offset, as described in the official documentation.
551 * @param len Length, as described in the official documentation.
552 */
553 void read(int64_t offset, unsigned int len);
554
555 /**
556 * @brief Sync [read](http://linux.die.net/man/2/preadv).
557 *
558 * @param offset Offset, as described in the official documentation.
559 * @param len Length, as described in the official documentation.
560 *
561 * @return A `std::pair` composed as it follows:
562 * * A boolean value that is true in case of success, false otherwise.
563 * * A `std::pair` composed as it follows:
564 * * A bunch of data read from the given path.
565 * * The amount of data read from the given path.
566 */
567 std::pair<bool, std::pair<std::unique_ptr<const char[]>, std::size_t>> readSync(int64_t offset, unsigned int len);
568
569 /**
570 * @brief Async [write](http://linux.die.net/man/2/pwritev).
571 *
572 * The request takes the ownership of the data and it is in charge of delete
573 * them.
574 *
575 * Emit a `FsEvent<FileReq::Type::WRITE>` event when completed.<br/>
576 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
577 *
578 * @param buf The data to be written.
579 * @param len The lenght of the submitted data.
580 * @param offset Offset, as described in the official documentation.
581 */
582 void write(std::unique_ptr<char[]> buf, unsigned int len, int64_t offset);
583
584 /**
585 * @brief Async [write](http://linux.die.net/man/2/pwritev).
586 *
587 * The request doesn't take the ownership of the data. Be sure that their
588 * lifetime overcome the one of the request.
589 *
590 * Emit a `FsEvent<FileReq::Type::WRITE>` event when completed.<br/>
591 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
592 *
593 * @param buf The data to be written.
594 * @param len The lenght of the submitted data.
595 * @param offset Offset, as described in the official documentation.
596 */
597 void write(char *buf, unsigned int len, int64_t offset);
598
599 /**
600 * @brief Sync [write](http://linux.die.net/man/2/pwritev).
601 *
602 * @param buf The data to be written.
603 * @param len The lenght of the submitted data.
604 * @param offset Offset, as described in the official documentation.
605 *
606 * @return A `std::pair` composed as it follows:
607 * * A boolean value that is true in case of success, false otherwise.
608 * * The amount of data written to the given path.
609 */
610 std::pair<bool, std::size_t> writeSync(std::unique_ptr<char[]> buf, unsigned int len, int64_t offset);
611
612 /**
613 * @brief Async [fstat](http://linux.die.net/man/2/fstat).
614 *
615 * Emit a `FsEvent<FileReq::Type::FSTAT>` event when completed.<br/>
616 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
617 */
618 void stat();
619
620 /**
621 * @brief Sync [fstat](http://linux.die.net/man/2/fstat).
622 *
623 * @return A `std::pair` composed as it follows:
624 * * A boolean value that is true in case of success, false otherwise.
625 * * An initialized instance of Stat.
626 */
627 std::pair<bool, Stat> statSync();
628
629 /**
630 * @brief Async [fsync](http://linux.die.net/man/2/fsync).
631 *
632 * Emit a `FsEvent<FileReq::Type::FSYNC>` event when completed.<br/>
633 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
634 */
635 void sync();
636
637 /**
638 * @brief Sync [fsync](http://linux.die.net/man/2/fsync).
639 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
640 */
641 bool syncSync();
642
643 /**
644 * @brief Async [fdatasync](http://linux.die.net/man/2/fdatasync).
645 *
646 * Emit a `FsEvent<FileReq::Type::FDATASYNC>` event when completed.<br/>
647 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
648 */
649 void datasync();
650
651 /**
652 * @brief Sync [fdatasync](http://linux.die.net/man/2/fdatasync).
653 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
654 */
655 bool datasyncSync();
656
657 /**
658 * @brief Async [ftruncate](http://linux.die.net/man/2/ftruncate).
659 *
660 * Emit a `FsEvent<FileReq::Type::FTRUNCATE>` event when completed.<br/>
661 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
662 *
663 * @param offset Offset, as described in the official documentation.
664 */
665 void truncate(int64_t offset);
666
667 /**
668 * @brief Sync [ftruncate](http://linux.die.net/man/2/ftruncate).
669 * @param offset Offset, as described in the official documentation.
670 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
671 */
672 bool truncateSync(int64_t offset);
673
674 /**
675 * @brief Async [sendfile](http://linux.die.net/man/2/sendfile).
676 *
677 * Emit a `FsEvent<FileReq::Type::SENDFILE>` event when completed.<br/>
678 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
679 *
680 * @param out A valid instance of FileHandle.
681 * @param offset Offset, as described in the official documentation.
682 * @param length Length, as described in the official documentation.
683 */
684 void sendfile(FileHandle out, int64_t offset, std::size_t length);
685
686 /**
687 * @brief Sync [sendfile](http://linux.die.net/man/2/sendfile).
688 *
689 * @param out A valid instance of FileHandle.
690 * @param offset Offset, as described in the official documentation.
691 * @param length Length, as described in the official documentation.
692 *
693 * @return A `std::pair` composed as it follows:
694 * * A boolean value that is true in case of success, false otherwise.
695 * * The amount of data transferred.
696 */
697 std::pair<bool, std::size_t> sendfileSync(FileHandle out, int64_t offset, std::size_t length);
698
699 /**
700 * @brief Async [fchmod](http://linux.die.net/man/2/fchmod).
701 *
702 * Emit a `FsEvent<FileReq::Type::FCHMOD>` event when completed.<br/>
703 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
704 *
705 * @param mode Mode, as described in the official documentation.
706 */
707 void chmod(int mode);
708
709 /**
710 * @brief Sync [fchmod](http://linux.die.net/man/2/fchmod).
711 * @param mode Mode, as described in the official documentation.
712 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
713 */
714 bool chmodSync(int mode);
715
716 /**
717 * @brief Async [futime](http://linux.die.net/man/3/futimes).
718 *
719 * Emit a `FsEvent<FileReq::Type::FUTIME>` event when completed.<br/>
720 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
721 *
722 * @param atime `std::chrono::duration<double>`, having the same meaning as
723 * described in the official documentation.
724 * @param mtime `std::chrono::duration<double>`, having the same meaning as
725 * described in the official documentation.
726 */
727 void futime(Time atime, Time mtime);
728
729 /**
730 * @brief Sync [futime](http://linux.die.net/man/3/futimes).
731 * @param atime `std::chrono::duration<double>`, having the same meaning as
732 * described in the official documentation.
733 * @param mtime `std::chrono::duration<double>`, having the same meaning as
734 * described in the official documentation.
735 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
736 */
737 bool futimeSync(Time atime, Time mtime);
738
739 /**
740 * @brief Async [fchown](http://linux.die.net/man/2/fchown).
741 *
742 * Emit a `FsEvent<FileReq::Type::FCHOWN>` event when completed.<br/>
743 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
744 *
745 * @param uid UID, as described in the official documentation.
746 * @param gid GID, as described in the official documentation.
747 */
748 void chown(Uid uid, Gid gid);
749
750 /**
751 * @brief Sync [fchown](http://linux.die.net/man/2/fchown).
752 * @param uid UID, as described in the official documentation.
753 * @param gid GID, as described in the official documentation.
754 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
755 */
756 bool chownSync(Uid uid, Gid gid);
757
758 /**
759 * @brief Cast operator to FileHandle.
760 *
761 * Cast operator to an internal representation of the underlying file
762 * handle.
763 *
764 * @return A valid instance of FileHandle (the descriptor can be invalid).
765 */
766 operator FileHandle() const noexcept;
767
768private:
769 std::unique_ptr<char[]> current{nullptr};
770 uv_buf_t buffer{};
771 uv_file file{BAD_FD};
772};
773
774
775/**
776 * @brief The FsReq request.
777 *
778 * Cross-platform sync and async filesystem operations.<br/>
779 * All file operations are run on the threadpool.
780 *
781 * To create a `FsReq` through a `Loop`, no arguments are required.
782 *
783 * See the official
784 * [documentation](http://docs.libuv.org/en/v1.x/fs.html)
785 * for further details.
786 */
787class FsReq final: public FsRequest<FsReq> {
788 static void fsReadlinkCallback(uv_fs_t *req);
789 static void fsReaddirCallback(uv_fs_t *req);
790
791public:
792 using CopyFile = details::UVCopyFileFlags;
793 using SymLink = details::UVSymLinkFlags;
794
795 using FsRequest::FsRequest;
796
797 ~FsReq() noexcept;
798
799 /**
800 * @brief Async [unlink](http://linux.die.net/man/2/unlink).
801 *
802 * Emit a `FsEvent<FsReq::Type::UNLINK>` event when completed.<br/>
803 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
804 *
805 * @param path Path, as described in the official documentation.
806 */
807 void unlink(std::string path);
808
809 /**
810 * @brief Sync [unlink](http://linux.die.net/man/2/unlink).
811 * @param path Path, as described in the official documentation.
812 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
813 */
814 bool unlinkSync(std::string path);
815
816 /**
817 * @brief Async [mkdir](http://linux.die.net/man/2/mkdir).
818 *
819 * Emit a `FsEvent<FsReq::Type::MKDIR>` event when completed.<br/>
820 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
821 *
822 * @param path Path, as described in the official documentation.
823 * @param mode Mode, as described in the official documentation.
824 */
825 void mkdir(std::string path, int mode);
826
827 /**
828 * @brief Sync [mkdir](http://linux.die.net/man/2/mkdir).
829 * @param path Path, as described in the official documentation.
830 * @param mode Mode, as described in the official documentation.
831 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
832 */
833 bool mkdirSync(std::string path, int mode);
834
835 /**
836 * @brief Async [mktemp](http://linux.die.net/man/3/mkdtemp).
837 *
838 * Emit a `FsEvent<FsReq::Type::MKDTEMP>` event when completed.<br/>
839 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
840 *
841 * @param tpl Template, as described in the official documentation.
842 */
843 void mkdtemp(std::string tpl);
844
845 /**
846 * @brief Sync [mktemp](http://linux.die.net/man/3/mkdtemp).
847 *
848 * @param tpl Template, as described in the official documentation.
849 *
850 * @return A `std::pair` composed as it follows:
851 * * A boolean value that is true in case of success, false otherwise.
852 * * The actual path of the newly created directory.
853 */
854 std::pair<bool, const char *> mkdtempSync(std::string tpl);
855
856 /**
857 * @brief Async [mkstemp](https://linux.die.net/man/3/mkstemp).
858 *
859 * Emit a `FsEvent<FsReq::Type::MKSTEMP>` event when completed.<br/>
860 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
861 *
862 * @param tpl Template, as described in the official documentation.
863 */
864 void mkstemp(std::string tpl);
865
866 /**
867 * @brief Sync [mkstemp](https://linux.die.net/man/3/mkstemp).
868 *
869 * Returns a composed value where:
870 *
871 * * The first parameter indicates the created file path.
872 * * The second parameter is the file descriptor as an integer.
873 *
874 * See the official
875 * [documentation](http://docs.libuv.org/en/v1.x/fs.html#c.uv_fs_mkstemp)
876 * for further details.
877 *
878 * @param tpl Template, as described in the official documentation.
879 *
880 * @return A pair where:
881
882 * * The first parameter is a boolean value that is true in case of success,
883 * false otherwise.
884 * * The second parameter is a composed value (see above).
885 */
886 std::pair<bool, std::pair<std::string, std::size_t>> mkstempSync(std::string tpl);
887
888 /**
889 * @brief Async [lutime](http://linux.die.net/man/3/lutimes).
890 *
891 * Emit a `FsEvent<FsReq::Type::UTIME>` event when completed.<br/>
892 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
893 *
894 * @param path Path, as described in the official documentation.
895 * @param atime `std::chrono::duration<double>`, having the same meaning as
896 * described in the official documentation.
897 * @param mtime `std::chrono::duration<double>`, having the same meaning as
898 * described in the official documentation.
899 */
900 void lutime(std::string path, Time atime, Time mtime);
901
902 /**
903 * @brief Sync [lutime](http://linux.die.net/man/3/lutimes).
904 * @param path Path, as described in the official documentation.
905 * @param atime `std::chrono::duration<double>`, having the same meaning as
906 * described in the official documentation.
907 * @param mtime `std::chrono::duration<double>`, having the same meaning as
908 * described in the official documentation.
909 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
910 */
911 bool lutimeSync(std::string path, Time atime, Time mtime);
912
913 /**
914 * @brief Async [rmdir](http://linux.die.net/man/2/rmdir).
915 *
916 * Emit a `FsEvent<FsReq::Type::RMDIR>` event when completed.<br/>
917 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
918 *
919 * @param path Path, as described in the official documentation.
920 */
921 void rmdir(std::string path);
922
923 /**
924 * @brief Sync [rmdir](http://linux.die.net/man/2/rmdir).
925 * @param path Path, as described in the official documentation.
926 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
927 */
928 bool rmdirSync(std::string path);
929
930 /**
931 * @brief Async [scandir](http://linux.die.net/man/3/scandir).
932 *
933 * Emit a `FsEvent<FsReq::Type::SCANDIR>` event when completed.<br/>
934 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
935 *
936 * @param path Path, as described in the official documentation.
937 * @param flags Flags, as described in the official documentation.
938 */
939 void scandir(std::string path, int flags);
940
941 /**
942 * @brief Sync [scandir](http://linux.die.net/man/3/scandir).
943 *
944 * @param path Path, as described in the official documentation.
945 * @param flags Flags, as described in the official documentation.
946 *
947 * @return A `std::pair` composed as it follows:
948 * * A boolean value that is true in case of success, false otherwise.
949 * * The number of directory entries selected.
950 */
951 std::pair<bool, std::size_t> scandirSync(std::string path, int flags);
952
953 /**
954 * @brief Gets entries populated with the next directory entry data.
955 *
956 * Returns a composed value where:
957 *
958 * * The first parameter indicates the entry type (see below).
959 * * The second parameter is a string that contains the actual value.
960 *
961 * Available entry types are:
962 *
963 * * `FsReq::EntryType::UNKNOWN`
964 * * `FsReq::EntryType::FILE`
965 * * `FsReq::EntryType::DIR`
966 * * `FsReq::EntryType::LINK`
967 * * `FsReq::EntryType::FIFO`
968 * * `FsReq::EntryType::SOCKET`
969 * * `FsReq::EntryType::CHAR`
970 * * `FsReq::EntryType::BLOCK`
971 *
972 * See the official
973 * [documentation](http://docs.libuv.org/en/v1.x/fs.html#c.uv_dirent_t)
974 * for further details.
975 *
976 * @return A pair where:
977 *
978 * * The first parameter is a boolean value that indicates if the current
979 * entry is still valid.
980 * * The second parameter is a composed value (see above).
981 */
982 std::pair<bool, std::pair<EntryType, const char *>> scandirNext();
983
984 /**
985 * @brief Async [stat](http://linux.die.net/man/2/stat).
986 *
987 * Emit a `FsEvent<FsReq::Type::STAT>` event when completed.<br/>
988 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
989 *
990 * @param path Path, as described in the official documentation.
991 */
992 void stat(std::string path);
993
994 /**
995 * @brief Sync [stat](http://linux.die.net/man/2/stat).
996 *
997 * @param path Path, as described in the official documentation.
998 *
999 * @return A `std::pair` composed as it follows:
1000 * * A boolean value that is true in case of success, false otherwise.
1001 * * An initialized instance of Stat.
1002 */
1003 std::pair<bool, Stat> statSync(std::string path);
1004
1005 /**
1006 * @brief Async [lstat](http://linux.die.net/man/2/lstat).
1007 *
1008 * Emit a `FsEvent<FsReq::Type::LSTAT>` event when completed.<br/>
1009 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
1010 *
1011 * @param path Path, as described in the official documentation.
1012 */
1013 void lstat(std::string path);
1014
1015 /**
1016 * @brief Sync [lstat](http://linux.die.net/man/2/lstat).
1017 *
1018 * @param path Path, as described in the official documentation.
1019 *
1020 * @return A `std::pair` composed as it follows:
1021 * * A boolean value that is true in case of success, false otherwise.
1022 * * An initialized instance of Stat.
1023 */
1024 std::pair<bool, Stat> lstatSync(std::string path);
1025
1026 /**
1027 * @brief Async [statfs](http://linux.die.net/man/2/statfs).
1028 *
1029 * Emit a `FsEvent<FsReq::Type::STATFS>` event when completed.<br/>
1030 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
1031 *
1032 * Any fields in the resulting object that are not supported by the
1033 * underlying operating system are set to zero.
1034 *
1035 * @param path Path, as described in the official documentation.
1036 */
1037 void statfs(std::string path);
1038
1039 /**
1040 * @brief Sync [statfs](http://linux.die.net/man/2/statfs).
1041 *
1042 * Any fields in the resulting object that are not supported by the
1043 * underlying operating system are set to zero.
1044 *
1045 * @param path Path, as described in the official documentation.
1046 *
1047 * @return A `std::pair` composed as it follows:
1048 * * A boolean value that is true in case of success, false otherwise.
1049 * * An initialized instance of Statfs.
1050 */
1051 std::pair<bool, Statfs> statfsSync(std::string path);
1052
1053 /**
1054 * @brief Async [rename](http://linux.die.net/man/2/rename).
1055 *
1056 * Emit a `FsEvent<FsReq::Type::RENAME>` event when completed.<br/>
1057 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
1058 *
1059 * @param old Old path, as described in the official documentation.
1060 * @param path New path, as described in the official documentation.
1061 */
1062 void rename(std::string old, std::string path);
1063
1064 /**
1065 * @brief Sync [rename](http://linux.die.net/man/2/rename).
1066 * @param old Old path, as described in the official documentation.
1067 * @param path New path, as described in the official documentation.
1068 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
1069 */
1070 bool renameSync(std::string old, std::string path);
1071
1072 /**
1073 * @brief Copies a file asynchronously from a path to a new one.
1074 *
1075 * Emit a `FsEvent<FsReq::Type::UV_FS_COPYFILE>` event when
1076 * completed.<br/>
1077 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
1078 *
1079 * Available flags are:
1080 *
1081 * * `FsReq::CopyFile::EXCL`: it fails if the destination path
1082 * already exists (the default behavior is to overwrite the destination if
1083 * it exists).
1084 * * `FsReq::CopyFile::FICLONE`: If present, it will attempt to create a
1085 * copy-on-write reflink. If the underlying platform does not support
1086 * copy-on-write, then a fallback copy mechanism is used.
1087 * * `FsReq::CopyFile::FICLONE_FORCE`: If present, it will attempt to create
1088 * a copy-on-write reflink. If the underlying platform does not support
1089 * copy-on-write, then an error is returned.
1090 *
1091 * @warning
1092 * If the destination path is created, but an error occurs while copying the
1093 * data, then the destination path is removed. There is a brief window of
1094 * time between closing and removing the file where another process could
1095 * access the file.
1096 *
1097 * @param old Old path, as described in the official documentation.
1098 * @param path New path, as described in the official documentation.
1099 * @param flags Optional additional flags.
1100 */
1101 void copyfile(std::string old, std::string path, Flags<CopyFile> flags = Flags<CopyFile>{});
1102
1103 /**
1104 * @brief Copies a file synchronously from a path to a new one.
1105 *
1106 * Available flags are:
1107 *
1108 * * `FsReq::CopyFile::EXCL`: it fails if the destination path
1109 * already exists (the default behavior is to overwrite the destination if
1110 * it exists).
1111 *
1112 * If the destination path is created, but an error occurs while copying the
1113 * data, then the destination path is removed. There is a brief window of
1114 * time between closing and removing the file where another process could
1115 * access the file.
1116 *
1117 * @param old Old path, as described in the official documentation.
1118 * @param path New path, as described in the official documentation.
1119 * @param flags Optional additional flags.
1120 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
1121 */
1122 bool copyfileSync(std::string old, std::string path, Flags<CopyFile> flags = Flags<CopyFile>{});
1123
1124 /**
1125 * @brief Async [access](http://linux.die.net/man/2/access).
1126 *
1127 * Emit a `FsEvent<FsReq::Type::ACCESS>` event when completed.<br/>
1128 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
1129 *
1130 * @param path Path, as described in the official documentation.
1131 * @param mode Mode, as described in the official documentation.
1132 */
1133 void access(std::string path, int mode);
1134
1135 /**
1136 * @brief Sync [access](http://linux.die.net/man/2/access).
1137 * @param path Path, as described in the official documentation.
1138 * @param mode Mode, as described in the official documentation.
1139 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
1140 */
1141 bool accessSync(std::string path, int mode);
1142
1143 /**
1144 * @brief Async [chmod](http://linux.die.net/man/2/chmod).
1145 *
1146 * Emit a `FsEvent<FsReq::Type::CHMOD>` event when completed.<br/>
1147 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
1148 *
1149 * @param path Path, as described in the official documentation.
1150 * @param mode Mode, as described in the official documentation.
1151 */
1152 void chmod(std::string path, int mode);
1153
1154 /**
1155 * @brief Sync [chmod](http://linux.die.net/man/2/chmod).
1156 * @param path Path, as described in the official documentation.
1157 * @param mode Mode, as described in the official documentation.
1158 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
1159 */
1160 bool chmodSync(std::string path, int mode);
1161
1162 /**
1163 * @brief Async [utime](http://linux.die.net/man/2/utime).
1164 *
1165 * Emit a `FsEvent<FsReq::Type::UTIME>` event when completed.<br/>
1166 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
1167 *
1168 * @param path Path, as described in the official documentation.
1169 * @param atime `std::chrono::duration<double>`, having the same meaning as
1170 * described in the official documentation.
1171 * @param mtime `std::chrono::duration<double>`, having the same meaning as
1172 * described in the official documentation.
1173 */
1174 void utime(std::string path, Time atime, Time mtime);
1175
1176 /**
1177 * @brief Sync [utime](http://linux.die.net/man/2/utime).
1178 * @param path Path, as described in the official documentation.
1179 * @param atime `std::chrono::duration<double>`, having the same meaning as
1180 * described in the official documentation.
1181 * @param mtime `std::chrono::duration<double>`, having the same meaning as
1182 * described in the official documentation.
1183 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
1184 */
1185 bool utimeSync(std::string path, Time atime, Time mtime);
1186
1187 /**
1188 * @brief Async [link](http://linux.die.net/man/2/link).
1189 *
1190 * Emit a `FsEvent<FsReq::Type::LINK>` event when completed.<br/>
1191 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
1192 *
1193 * @param old Old path, as described in the official documentation.
1194 * @param path New path, as described in the official documentation.
1195 */
1196 void link(std::string old, std::string path);
1197
1198 /**
1199 * @brief Sync [link](http://linux.die.net/man/2/link).
1200 * @param old Old path, as described in the official documentation.
1201 * @param path New path, as described in the official documentation.
1202 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
1203 */
1204 bool linkSync(std::string old, std::string path);
1205
1206 /**
1207 * @brief Async [symlink](http://linux.die.net/man/2/symlink).
1208 *
1209 * Emit a `FsEvent<FsReq::Type::SYMLINK>` event when completed.<br/>
1210 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
1211 *
1212 * Available flags are:
1213 *
1214 * * `FsReq::SymLink::DIR`: it indicates that the old path points to a
1215 * directory.
1216 * * `FsReq::SymLink::JUNCTION`: it requests that the symlink is created
1217 * using junction points.
1218 *
1219 * @param old Old path, as described in the official documentation.
1220 * @param path New path, as described in the official documentation.
1221 * @param flags Optional additional flags.
1222 */
1223 void symlink(std::string old, std::string path, Flags<SymLink> flags = Flags<SymLink>{});
1224
1225 /**
1226 * @brief Sync [symlink](http://linux.die.net/man/2/symlink).
1227 *
1228 * Available flags are:
1229 *
1230 * * `FsReq::SymLink::DIR`: it indicates that the old path points to a
1231 * directory.
1232 * * `FsReq::SymLink::JUNCTION`: it requests that the symlink is created
1233 * using junction points.
1234 *
1235 * @param old Old path, as described in the official documentation.
1236 * @param path New path, as described in the official documentation.
1237 * @param flags Flags, as described in the official documentation.
1238 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
1239 */
1240 bool symlinkSync(std::string old, std::string path, Flags<SymLink> flags = Flags<SymLink>{});
1241
1242 /**
1243 * @brief Async [readlink](http://linux.die.net/man/2/readlink).
1244 *
1245 * Emit a `FsEvent<FsReq::Type::READLINK>` event when completed.<br/>
1246 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
1247 *
1248 * @param path Path, as described in the official documentation.
1249 */
1250 void readlink(std::string path);
1251
1252 /**
1253 * @brief Sync [readlink](http://linux.die.net/man/2/readlink).
1254 *
1255 * @param path Path, as described in the official documentation.
1256 *
1257 * @return A `std::pair` composed as it follows:
1258 * * A boolean value that is true in case of success, false otherwise.
1259 * * A `std::pair` composed as it follows:
1260 * * A bunch of data read from the given path.
1261 * * The amount of data read from the given path.
1262 */
1263 std::pair<bool, std::pair<const char *, std::size_t>> readlinkSync(std::string path);
1264
1265 /**
1266 * @brief Async [realpath](http://linux.die.net/man/3/realpath).
1267 *
1268 * Emit a `FsEvent<FsReq::Type::REALPATH>` event when completed.<br/>
1269 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
1270 *
1271 * @param path Path, as described in the official documentation.
1272 */
1273 void realpath(std::string path);
1274
1275 /**
1276 * @brief Sync [realpath](http://linux.die.net/man/3/realpath).
1277 *
1278 * @param path Path, as described in the official documentation.
1279 *
1280 * @return A `std::pair` composed as it follows:
1281 * * A boolean value that is true in case of success, false otherwise.
1282 * * The canonicalized absolute pathname.
1283 */
1284 std::pair<bool, const char *> realpathSync(std::string path);
1285
1286 /**
1287 * @brief Async [chown](http://linux.die.net/man/2/chown).
1288 *
1289 * Emit a `FsEvent<FsReq::Type::CHOWN>` event when completed.<br/>
1290 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
1291 *
1292 * @param path Path, as described in the official documentation.
1293 * @param uid UID, as described in the official documentation.
1294 * @param gid GID, as described in the official documentation.
1295 */
1296 void chown(std::string path, Uid uid, Gid gid);
1297
1298 /**
1299 * @brief Sync [chown](http://linux.die.net/man/2/chown).
1300 * @param path Path, as described in the official documentation.
1301 * @param uid UID, as described in the official documentation.
1302 * @param gid GID, as described in the official documentation.
1303 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
1304 */
1305 bool chownSync(std::string path, Uid uid, Gid gid);
1306
1307 /**
1308 * @brief Async [lchown](https://linux.die.net/man/2/lchown).
1309 *
1310 * Emit a `FsEvent<FsReq::Type::LCHOWN>` event when completed.<br/>
1311 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
1312 *
1313 * @param path Path, as described in the official documentation.
1314 * @param uid UID, as described in the official documentation.
1315 * @param gid GID, as described in the official documentation.
1316 */
1317 void lchown(std::string path, Uid uid, Gid gid);
1318
1319 /**
1320 * @brief Sync [lchown](https://linux.die.net/man/2/lchown).
1321 * @param path Path, as described in the official documentation.
1322 * @param uid UID, as described in the official documentation.
1323 * @param gid GID, as described in the official documentation.
1324 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
1325 */
1326 bool lchownSync(std::string path, Uid uid, Gid gid);
1327
1328 /**
1329 * @brief Opens a path asynchronously as a directory stream.
1330 *
1331 * Emit a `FsEvent<FsReq::Type::OPENDIR>` event when completed.<br/>
1332 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
1333 *
1334 * The contents of the directory can be iterated over by means of the
1335 * `readdir` od `readdirSync` member functions. The memory allocated by this
1336 * function must be freed by calling `closedir` or `closedirSync`.
1337 *
1338 * @param path The path to open as a directory stream.
1339 */
1340 void opendir(std::string path);
1341
1342 /**
1343 * @brief Opens a path synchronously as a directory stream.
1344 *
1345 * The contents of the directory can be iterated over by means of the
1346 * `readdir` od `readdirSync` member functions. The memory allocated by this
1347 * function must be freed by calling `closedir` or `closedirSync`.
1348 *
1349 * @param path The path to open as a directory stream.
1350 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
1351 */
1352 bool opendirSync(std::string path);
1353
1354 /**
1355 * @brief Closes asynchronously a directory stream.
1356 *
1357 * Emit a `FsEvent<FsReq::Type::CLOSEDIR>` event when completed.<br/>
1358 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
1359 *
1360 * It frees also the memory allocated internally when a path has been opened
1361 * as a directory stream.
1362 */
1363 void closedir();
1364
1365 /**
1366 * @brief Closes synchronously a directory stream.
1367 *
1368 * It frees also the memory allocated internally when a path has been opened
1369 * as a directory stream.
1370 *
1371 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
1372 */
1373 bool closedirSync();
1374
1375 /**
1376 * @brief Iterates asynchronously over a directory stream one entry at a
1377 * time.
1378 *
1379 * Emit a `FsEvent<FsReq::Type::READDIR>` event when completed.<br/>
1380 * Emit an ErrorEvent event in case of errors.
1381 *
1382 * This function isn't thread safe. Moreover, it doesn't return the `.` and
1383 * `..` entries.
1384 */
1385 void readdir();
1386
1387 /**
1388 * @brief Iterates synchronously over a directory stream one entry at a
1389 * time.
1390 *
1391 * Returns a composed value where:
1392 *
1393 * * The first parameter indicates the entry type (see below).
1394 * * The second parameter is a string that contains the actual value.
1395 *
1396 * Available entry types are:
1397 *
1398 * * `FsReq::EntryType::UNKNOWN`
1399 * * `FsReq::EntryType::FILE`
1400 * * `FsReq::EntryType::DIR`
1401 * * `FsReq::EntryType::LINK`
1402 * * `FsReq::EntryType::FIFO`
1403 * * `FsReq::EntryType::SOCKET`
1404 * * `FsReq::EntryType::CHAR`
1405 * * `FsReq::EntryType::BLOCK`
1406 *
1407 * See the official
1408 * [documentation](http://docs.libuv.org/en/v1.x/fs.html#c.uv_dirent_t)
1409 * for further details.
1410 *
1411 * This function isn't thread safe. Moreover, it doesn't return the `.` and
1412 * `..` entries.
1413 *
1414 * @return A pair where:
1415 *
1416 * * The first parameter is a boolean value that indicates if the current
1417 * entry is still valid.
1418 * * The second parameter is a composed value (see above).
1419 */
1420 std::pair<bool, std::pair<EntryType, const char *>> readdirSync();
1421
1422private:
1423 uv_dirent_t dirents[1];
1424};
1425
1426
1427/*! @brief Helper functions. */
1428struct FsHelper {
1429 /**
1430 * @brief Gets the OS dependent handle.
1431 *
1432 * For a file descriptor in the C runtime, get the OS-dependent handle. On
1433 * UNIX, returns the file descriptor as-is. On Windows, this calls a system
1434 * function.<br/>
1435 * Note that the return value is still owned by the C runtime, any attempts
1436 * to close it or to use it after closing the file descriptor may lead to
1437 * malfunction.
1438 */
1439 static OSFileDescriptor handle(FileHandle file) noexcept;
1440
1441 /**
1442 * @brief Gets the file descriptor.
1443 *
1444 * For a OS-dependent handle, get the file descriptor in the C runtime. On
1445 * UNIX, returns the file descriptor as-is. On Windows, this calls a system
1446 * function.<br/>
1447 * Note that the return value is still owned by the C runtime, any attempts
1448 * to close it or to use it after closing the handle may lead to
1449 * malfunction.
1450 */
1451 static FileHandle open(OSFileDescriptor descriptor) noexcept;
1452};
1453
1454
1455}
1456

1459#include "fs.cpp"
1460#endif
1461
1462#endif // UVW_FS_INCLUDE_H
